src:
Poketino: Poštujem Zvezdu, Kejn: Biću bolji nego protiv Partizana
05 Nov 2019, 19:27 by Darko
Menadžer Totenhema Maurisio Poketino priznao je da je prošlogodišnji poraz Liverpula od Crvene zvezde upozorenje za njegov tim i apostrofirao veliku podršku sa tribina koju imaju izabranici Vladana Milojevića.
– Za svaki tim je bolje kada igra na svom terenu. Znamo da će atmosfera biti paklena, čuli smo puno o njoj… Videli smo kako je Liverpul izgubio u Beogradu, poštujemo Zvezdu, pokazaćemo to, ali uradicemo sve da pobedimo. Biće velika borba, rekao je Poketino na konferenciji za novinare u Beogradu, prenosi Tanjug.
Londonski tim nije u pravoj formi ove sezone, pa se tako spekuliše o mogućem odlasku Poketina.

– Nadam se da ovo nije kraj ere. Imam još tri godine ugovor i očekujem da ga odslužim.

U prestonicu Srbije Totenhem je došao oslabljen za nekoliko igrača zbog povreda Uga Lorisa i Erika Lamele, a nisu tu ni Jan Vertongen, Serž Orije i Heri Vinks.
Za razliku od pomenute petorice u konkurenciji je Hjeon Min Son i to posle emotivnog sloma jer je slomio nogu Andreu Gomešu.
– Svi igrači iz Totenhema žale zbog toga. Drago mi je da je operacija prošla dobro, Gomešu šaljemo najbolje želje i nadamo se da će se sve biti ubredu. Son je u redu, bilo je dosta emocija… Oseća se OK i u formi je, zaključio je Poketino.
Kapiten Totenhema Hari Kejn izjavio je da je spreman za duel protiv Crvene zvezde posle oporavka od virusa i da je svestan teškog meča i atmosfere u Beogradu.
Kejn je propustio u nedelju gostovanje Evertonu u Premijer ligi, ali će biti u sastavu za duel sa Zvezdom u 4. kolu B grupe Lige šampiona.
– Osećam se bolje nego prethodnih dana. Uhvatio me je virus, sada sam dobro. Juče sam trenirao, večeras ću takođe i videćemo kako će izgledati sve, rekao je Kejn.
Kejn se prisetio prethodnog gostovanja u Beogradu, kada je protiv Partizana u Ligi Evrope završen meč bez golova.
– Sećam se i da sam udario nogom stativu (iz besa). Nije bila moja najbolja utakmica. Sećam se da je bilo teško sa nerešenim ishodom. Verujem da ću odigrati bolje nego tada, rekao je on.
Engleski golgeter svestan je vruće atmosfere sa tribina „Marakane“.
– Čuo sam da će atmosfera biti vruća, ali kada izađemo na teren fokusiraćemo se samo na sebe. Zvezda je pokazala da može da nas ugrozi, imala je šanse da izjednači u Londonu, ali nije i moglo je sve da bude drugačije. Moramo da ostanemo skoncentrisani, zaključio je Kejn, dodavši da se nada da neće biti rasističkih ispada kao u Sofiji.
Meč 4. kola Lige šampiona između fudbalera Crvene zvezde i Totenhema zakazana je za sredu od 21 sat.

POVEZANE OBJAVE
text:
Poketino: I respect Star, Kane: I'll be better than against Partizan
05 Nov 2019, 18:27 by Darko
Tottenham manager Maurisio Poketino acknowledged last year's defeat of Liverpool by the Red Star was a warning to his team and underscored the overwhelming support from the bleachers of Vladan Milojevic.
- It is better for each team when playing on their own court. We know the atmosphere is going to be hellish, we have heard a lot about it… We have seen Liverpool lose in Belgrade, we respect the Star, we will show it, but we will do everything to win. It will be a big fight, Poketino said at a press conference in Belgrade, Tanjug reports.
The London team is not in proper shape this season, so speculation is made about the possible departure of Poketin.

- I hope this is not the end of an era. I have another three years contract and I expect to serve him.

Tottenham came to the Serbian capital for a few players due to injuries to Hugo Loris and Eric Lamela, with Jan Vertongen, Serge Oriya and Harry Winks missing.
Unlike the aforementioned five, Hyeon Min Son is in the competition after an emotional breakdown because he broke his leg with Andrea Gomes.
- All Tottenham players regret it. I'm glad the operation went well, we send our best wishes to Gomez and hope everything works out. Son is fine, there was a lot of emotion ... He feels OK and is in shape, concluded Poketino.
Tottenham captain Harry Kane said he was ready for the Red Star duel after recovering from the virus and was aware of the tough match and atmosphere in Belgrade.
Kane missed Sunday's visit to Everton in the Premier League, but will be in the squad for a match with the Stars in round 4 of the Champions League Group B.
- I feel better than in the previous days. I got the virus, I'm fine now. I trained yesterday, tonight I will also see what everything will look like, Kane said.
Kane recalled his previous away visit to Belgrade when a goalless match was completed against Partizan in the Europa League.
- I also remember kicking a tripod (out of anger). It wasn't my best game. I remember it was difficult with the outcome unresolved. I believe I will play better than I did then, he said.
The English golfer is aware of the hot atmosphere from the Marakana stands.
- I have heard that the atmosphere will be hot, but when we go out into the field we will focus only on ourselves. The star showed that she could endanger us, she had a chance to equalize in London, but it couldn't and everything could have been different. We need to stay focused, Kane concluded, adding that he hoped there would be no racist outbursts like in Sofia.
The Champions League Round 4 match between Red Star and Tottenham is scheduled for 9pm on Wednesday.
